Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days, worsened by head movement; feeling of room spinning around; nausea; fast heartbeat; light-headedness. Afraid of brain tumor due to friend's diagnosis; wants to get rid of dizziness. No fever, headache, or ear problems; no hearing loss, ringing in ears, or speech difficulties; no loss of function in arms or legs; no recent illness or bed confinement; no smoking, alcohol, or drug use.
Objective: BP 110/70; pulse 62/min; neurological examination: normal facial sensation; normal eye movements; no nystagmus; normal muscle strength and coordination; positive HIT test on one side; provoked symptoms with positional change.
Assessment: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV); ruled out brain tumor.
Plan: Perform Epley manoeuvre to help alleviate symptoms
Provide instructions for self-performance of Epley manoeuvre via thuisarts.nl
Follow-up to assess effectiveness of treatment
